Description.val:
The Submarine Acoustic Warfare System (SAWS) provides submarines with an enhanced capability against torpedoes and the means to reduce the acoustic and non-acoustic effectiveness of enemy sensors.  This program provides ongoing production of countermeasure devices needed to sustain fleet inventories, production of preplanned improvements to enhance the readiness and effectiveness of countermeasure devices and associated inboard and outboard countermeasure launcher systems.

[P40A / WM014 6]: WM014 6" Diameter Countermeasures - Procures the 6" Countermeasure Launch Tube, Acoustic Device Countermeasure (ADC)  MK3 (Torpedo) and Acoustic Device Countermeasure (ADC) MK4 (Sound Navigation and Ranging (SONAR), Engineering Change Proposals (ECPs) and Configuration Control.

[P40A / WM015 3]: WM015 3" Diameter Countermeasures - Procures Noise Acoustic Emitter (NAE) BEACON, Acoustic Device Countermeasure (ADC) MK2 MOD 3 & 5, Next Generation Countermeasure (NGCM), Engineering Change Proposals (ECPs) and Configuration Control.

[P40A / WM018 ACOUSTIC AUGMENTATION SUPPORT PROGRAM (AASP)]: Procures acoustic augmenting devices in various configurations for all submarine platforms.

[P40A / WM019 CSA ]: WM019 Engineering Changes - Procures engineering changes in support of SAWS including Countermeasures Set Acoustic (CSA) system Launch Control Panels (LCPs), CSA support System Assets, and correcting obsolescence.

[P40A / WM022 GAS GENERATOR MK77]: WM022 Gas Generator (GG) MK 77 - Procures the propulsion components required to launch the ADC MK3 and ADC MK4 Countermeasure devices out of the External Countermeasure Launchers(ECLs).

[P40A / WM830 PRODUCTION ENGINEERING]: WM830 Production Engineering - Procures production engineering services for SAWS Technical Design Agent (TDA) and In-Service Engineering Agent (ISEA).

[P40A / WM900 CONSULTING SERVICES]: WM900 Consulting Services - Procures contractor consulting services for SAWS.

Name.@footnote: Changes in FY15, FY16 and FY17 are due to rounding.  Minor additional quantity of Launch Tubes procured.  With the reduction in ADC MK4 planned procurements to 0, 20 fewer Launch Tubes are necessary.

FY12 ADC MK3 (TORPEDO) and ADC MK 4 (SONAR) 6 Diameter Countermeasures:   It was determined that the ADC MK 4 inventory in FY12 was sufficient to meet current fleet requirements so no procurement of ADC MK 4 units were required.    The ADC MK 3 FY 12 procurement was increased to 160 units to meet fleet needs. Changes in FY16 and FY17 are due to rounding. Cost for ADC MK3 reflects revised Unit Cost from that used in the PB12 budget.

FY 12 ADC MK 4 (SONAR) 6 Diameter Countermeasures:   It was determined that the ADC MK 4 inventory in FY12 was sufficient to meet current fleet requirements so no procurement of ADC MK 4 units were required.  $309K moved from WM014 ADC MK4 to WM019 CSA MK Engineering Change for emergent CSA work needed to meet TI-14 connection to Submarine Warfare Federated Tactical System (SWFTS).  ADC MK 4 procurements are required for FY13 to restock expended and expired units.  Changes in FY15, FY16 and FY18 are due to rounding.

Changes in FY16, FY17, and FY18 are due to rounding.  No NAE Beacons were procured in FY12 because of contract award delay; Funding was reallocated to buy additional ADC Mk2 Mod3/5 ($3,390K); and to production engineering ($909K).

WM015 ADC MK2 FY12 the unit price for this option was slightly higher than anticipated.  The procurement quantity was reduced from 224 units to 189 units to accommodate this difference.  FY15 - FY18 procurements will be part of a larger buy that procures ADC MK 2s for the SSTD program budget line item 3113.  Changes in FY15, FY16, and FY17 unit cost and total cost are due to rounding.  Additional ADC Mk2 Mod3/5s were procured with funding available due to not buying NAE Beacons (619 additional).
Acoustic Intercept (AI) funding reduced due to elimination of TDA for AN/WLR-9.
AASP funding increased with addition from AI and additional support for SBIR effort funded.
CSA (Launcher) ISEA effort increased by $184K from NAE Beacon reallocation

WM019 FY12 $309K moved from WM014 ADC MK4 for emergent CSA work needed to meet TI-14 connection to SWFTS.  CSA MK3 Engineering Change effort augmented with funding from NAE Beacon to reduce risk for NGCM engineering modifications. ($391K).

WM022 Gas Generator (GG) MK77 fluctuation in quantities is due to a combination of three factors: qualification and availability of the Mod1 GG starting with LRIP in FY14; expiring lots of the butarez energetic component and continuing rework using those remaining Mod0 GG and the need to build the inventory to Non Nuclear Ordinance Requirement (NNOR) levels and then reduce production to more steady state Non Combat Expenditure Allowance (NCEA) level.  Changes in FY14, FY15, and FY18 are due to rounding.   Cost for MK77 GG production and rework increased due to some minor redesign efforts required ($303k).
Production Engineering effort increased due to reallocation of funding from NAE Beacon and to more accurately reflect costs.
Consulting costs increased slighly due to some additional tasking.
